title: 1961–62 FAI Cup
text:
The FAI Cup 1961–62 was the 41st edition of <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland's</a> premier <a href="Single-elimination%20tournament">cup</a> competition, The <a href="Football%20Association%20of%20Ireland">Football Association of Ireland</a> Challenge Cup or <a href="FAI%20Cup">FAI Cup</a>. The tournament began on 18 February 1962 and concluded on 28 April with the final held at <a href="Dalymount%20Park">Dalymount Park</a>, <a href="Dublin">Dublin</a>. An official attendance of 32,000 people watched <a href="Shamrock%20Rovers">Shamrock Rovers</a> win their 14th FAI Cup title by defeating local rivals and <a href="League%20of%20Ireland%201961%E2%80%9362">League Champions</a> <a href="Shelbourne%20F.C.">Shelbourne</a> 4-1.
Notes.
A. Attendances were calculated using gate receipts which limited their accuracy as a large proportion of people, particularly children, attended football matches in <a href="Republic%20of%20Ireland">Ireland</a> throughout the 20th century for free by a number of means.
